Here are some recommendations based on the user's preferences:

- A Farewell to Arms (1929) directed by Erich von Stroheim. The movie is set during World War I and follows an English nurse named Anna Schenker and a young American ambulance driver named John Wintrobe. The two main characters fall in love while fighting against the horrors of war. A Farewell to Arms is considered one of the greatest movies ever made.

- A Bridge Too Far (1978) directed by Steven Spielberg. The movie is set during World War II and follows several high-ranking officers including British Field Marshal Bernard "Monty" de Broglie, American Air Force General Dwight D. Eisenhower, German Luftwaffe General Adolf Hitler and Polish Intelligence Service Captain Janos Szafranski. The two main characters, Field Marshal de Broglie and American Air Force General Eisenhower, have a history of rivalry that has led to several high-profile conflicts including the Battle of Britain in 1940 and the Battle of El Alamein in 1942. In A Bridge Too Far, these two main characters are forced to confront each other once again when they are both assigned to command the Allied forces during World War II. The movie is considered one of the greatest movies ever made.

- 300 (2005) directed by Simon West. The movie is set during the Battle of Thermopylae in 480 BC, which was fought between an alliance of Greek city-states led by Spartan King Leonidas and a massive Persian army commanded by Xerxes, King of Persia. In 300, the main characters are Spartan King Leonidas, Spartan General Gaius Bellicius, Spartan General Phileas Harkles, Spartan General Leonidas' wife Cassandra and several other Spartan soldiers who join forces with Leonidas during the Battle of Thermopylae in 480 BC. The movie is considered one of the greatest movies ever made.
